skillTree.localised_description: The Fly Lord and his devotees despise Tzeentch, for his obsession with schemes and trickery are the polar opposite of Nurgle's delight in slow, musty stagnation.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Tzeentchian factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Tzeentchian factions

skillTree.localised_description: Anything fired at this vile Nurglish servant's immense girth must penetrate many folds of sweaty fat before they even have the slightest chance of piercing his flesh.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +20% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +35% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +50% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
	(all units in army)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: And so I travelled North, following the winds to the terrible gate between worlds.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +2 per turn
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Tremble before me, mortals!
His smile is infectious.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 5% for Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Raw Chaos energy is deadlier than any poison.

Attrition: +50% casualties suffered from Chaos Undivided corruption and Chaos Wastes attrition

skillTree.localised_description: With me at your back, nothing shall defeat us!

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve minimum: +25
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Imagine a rubbery, pus-filled bag lurching towards you. Now imagine it is travelling at twice its usual speed...

skillTree.localised_description: Sensible enemies think at least twice before attacking such a diseased specimen, for even if they win, chances are they have caught something really nasty along the way.

skillTree.localised_description: Grandfather loves the smallest of his many children at least as much as his myriad other grim creations, if not more so.

skillTree.localised_description: The flying things are beloved of Nurgle, for they are, oft-times, the method of infection for his most potent, hideous infirmities.

skillTree.localised_description: None more foul. None more black. Yuk.

skillTree.localised_description: Sickness so vile that it strikes as true and as hard as the perfect sword-blow.

skillTree.localised_description: The corrosive ooze emanating from the most ulcerous sores is one of the most effective weapons in the Urfather's foul armoury.

Speed: +10% for Pox Riders of Nurgle, Plague Toads of Nurgle, Warhounds, Chaos Knights, Marauder Horsemen, Chaos Chariots and Spawn of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: The air most creatures breathe provides just another avenue of attack for Nurgle and his many and varied contagions.

skillTree.localised_description: Blade and point and spell can be turned aside very easily by the Fly Lord's most-favoured servants.

ui_effects.localised_text: Will spread to enemies within the Spread Range metres of affected unit

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption – as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Just as all life is born, so it must wither and die. Before that happens comes disease, in all its disgusting, filth-ridden glory.
Battles can be lost, but can the war ever really be won? The advance of Ruin can never truly be halted once and for all.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those corrupted by Nurgle's rot flock to his putrid banner in the hope that they will be reborn anew in Grandfather's image.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

ui_effects.localised_text: Will spread to enemies within the Spread Range metres of affected unit

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +20%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!
Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors

Ambush defence chance: +10%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description:
Enemy battle reinforcement time: +10%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you spend almost any time too close to this vile infector you'll regret it, assuming you live to tell the tale that is.

effects.description:
Chance of a plague spreading: +10%
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Unusually subtle for one so foul, this one is skilled in spreading Nurgle's insanitary ways and words across the land.

effects.description:
Attrition: +25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(enemy armies in region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This one finds the enemy can barely stand to come near them, let alone attack.
When this one's countless lesions and warts finish weeping and harden up, a natural, protective carapace is left behind in their place.
If a population are confined to their toilets or beds at home they're not able to spread dissent and sedition as readily, if at all.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Ogres aside, being this large and ungainly would almost certainly kill most other creatures, but when you're beloved of the Urfather it is actually an advantage.
Other will also feel it.
Arrows will break.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 5% for Plaguebearers of Nurgle and Exalted Plaguebearers of Nurgle units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Nurglings hordes never end.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5% for Nurglings units
	(all units in army)

Armour: +5 for Nurglings units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Let them come.
Lands will rot.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 when defending 
	(all units in army)
